intro: Billardiera drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers followed by small, fleshy berries. It is characterized by its unique habit of forming dense clusters on its host, often appearing as a mistletoe-like growth. Billardiera drummondii plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for various birds and insects.
